page.title: 03FARMING, ANIMALS & BUILDINGS
page.content: Although crops cover most of our project area, many animals are also to be seen. On our visits we saw cows, bullocks, sheep, hens, pigs and horses. We recognised Friesian cows and Charollais bulls and were told that they were fed on hay, silage, barley and cattle cake. Sheep were seen mainly on the land close to the A19. Hens and pigs are kept by householders as well as farmers and are particularly useful for cleaning up rough ground very quickly. There are two large chicken farms in the area. The farmhouses are a mixture of styles.Some are very old and have changed very little. Others have been modernised and, in some cases, farmers have built brand new houses for themselves and their families.
